item.title: Recursively Merging JSONB in PostgreSQL
item.description: In addition to storing primitive data types such as INT, FLOAT and VARCHAR, PostgreSQL supports storing JSON and binary JSON (JSONB). These JSON types have a wide variety of functions and operators. One of the more common and useful operators is the concatenation operator, ||, which concatenates two jsonb values into a new JSONB value. Example: postgres=> SELECT '{"a": 1, "b": 2}'::jsonb || '{"b": 5, "c": 6}'::jsonb as result; result -------------------------- {"a": 1, "b": 5, "c": 6} However, this concatenation is limiting.
